name: Yosemite National Park
description: Yosemite National Park is renowned for its majestic granite cliffs, waterfalls, giant sequoia trees, and diverse ecosystems. Located in California's Sierra Nevada, the park offers a variety of recreational opportunities, including hiking, camping, and sightseeing.

locations.name: Yosemite Valley
locations.description: The heart of the park, home to iconic landmarks like El Capitan, Half Dome, and Yosemite Falls.

locations.name: Glacier Point
locations.description: Offers panoramic views of Yosemite Valley, Half Dome, and the High Sierra peaks.

locations.name: Mariposa Grove of Giant Sequoias
locations.description: Home to over 500 mature giant sequoias, including Grizzly Giant and California Tunnel Tree.

locations.name: Tuolumne Meadows
locations.description: A high-altitude area offering alpine lakes, wildflower meadows, and access to the John Muir Trail.

locations.name: Wawona
locations.description: Historic area with access to the Mariposa Grove and the Pioneer Yosemite History Center.

locations.name: Hetch Hetchy
locations.description: A reservoir area offering hiking opportunities and views of waterfalls like Tueeulala and Wapama.

trails.name: Mist Trail
trails.description: A popular trail leading to Vernal and Nevada Falls, offering misty conditions from waterfall spray.

trails.name: Half Dome Trail
trails.description: Challenging hike to the summit of Half Dome, requiring a permit and featuring cable-assisted sections.

trails.name: Yosemite Falls Trail
trails.description: Steep trail leading to the top of North America's tallest waterfall.

trails.name: Panorama Trail
trails.description: Offers sweeping views of Yosemite Valley, including Glacier Point and Illilouette Basin.

trails.name: John Muir Trail
trails.description: Long-distance trail running through the Sierra Nevada, passing through Yosemite's Tuolumne Meadows.

visitor_centers.name: Yosemite Valley Visitor Center
visitor_centers.description: Provides information, exhibits, and ranger programs about the park's natural and cultural history.

visitor_centers.name: Wawona Visitor Center
visitor_centers.description: Offers historical exhibits and information about the southern entrance to the park.

visitor_centers.name: Big Oak Flat Visitor Center
visitor_centers.description: Provides information and exhibits about the park's northern entrance and surrounding areas.

campgrounds.name: Upper Pines Campground
campgrounds.description: The largest campground in Yosemite Valley, open year-round with reservations required.

campgrounds.name: Lower Pines Campground
campgrounds.description: Smaller campground near the Merced River, open seasonally with reservations required.

campgrounds.name: North Pines Campground
campgrounds.description: Campground located near the Merced River, open seasonally with reservations required.

campgrounds.name: Tuolumne Meadows Campground
campgrounds.description: High-altitude campground offering access to alpine trails and lakes, open seasonally with reservations required.

campgrounds.name: Wawona Campground
campgrounds.description: Campground located near the southern entrance, open year-round with reservations required.

campgrounds.name: Crane Flat Campground
campgrounds.description: Campground located near the Big Oak Flat entrance, open seasonally with reservations required.

campgrounds.name: White Wolf Campground
campgrounds.description: High-elevation campground offering access to alpine trails, open seasonally with reservations required.

campgrounds.name: Tamarack Flat Campground
campgrounds.description: Remote campground offering a more secluded experience, open seasonally with reservations required.

campgrounds.name: Bridalveil Creek Campground
campgrounds.description: Campground located near the southern entrance, open seasonally with reservations required.

campgrounds.name: Porcupine Flat Campground
campgrounds.description: Campground located near the North Dome trailhead, open seasonally with reservations required.

safety_tips: Carry and drink plenty of water; dehydration is a major hazard.
Avoid hiking during midday heat in summer.
Stay on marked trails to protect fragile ecosystems.
Store food in bear-proof containers to prevent wildlife encounters.
Inform others of your hiking plans before heading out.
